itemDescription: first recorded airman killed by Manfred von Richthofen

wikipedia_page.main: Tom Rees (18 May 1895 – 17 September 1916) was a British Army officer who served in the Royal Flying Corps during the First World War. Joining the military in early 1915, Rees was raised to the rank of lieutenant before his 21st birthday, and eventually reached captain on the day of his death. He was killed on 17 September 1916 while flying as an observer in an F.E.2b aircraft, which was shot down by Manfred von Richthofen, the German flying ace who was later known as the "Red Baron". The aircraft was the first of Richthofen's 80 credited aerial combat victories.

response: * Tom Rees (rugby union, born 1913) (1913–1991), Welsh international rugby union prop
* Tom Rees (rugby union, born 1984), rugby union footballer of the 2000 and 2010s for England, and London Wasps
* Tom Rees (RFC officer) (1895–1916), first man killed by the "Red Baron"
* Tom Rees, physician and co-founder of AMREF
